name: reknit
content:
reknit verb [I or T]
(MAKE CLOTHES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle reknitting | past tense and past participle reknitted or reknit to knit (= make clothes using two long needles and wool, etc.) again: I had to undo the back and reknit it. I unpicked and re-knitted every single part of the jacket.
More examplesFewer examplesI must have re-knit this sweater at least four times.Seeing the finished garment made it worth all the messing around and reknitting that I had to do.After I realized where I had been going wrong, I began to reknit in a happier state of mind.

reknit verb [I or T]
(JOIN)
present participle reknitting | past tense and past participle reknit to join or come together again, or to make something do this: The muscle did not re-knit well after the injury. The victims are trying to reknit their lives. This once deeply divided country has now reknit itself.
More examplesFewer examplesThe flesh has started to re-knit around the bone.The community gradually began to reknit.
